intro: Plocama eriantha, commonly known as the velvetleaf or silverleaf, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, silver-green leaves and showy, blue-violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Plocama eriantha is often found in wetlands, swamps, and along the edges of water bodies.
